result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Miranda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Miranda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:03 PM: Defendant Carlos Miranda in court, appearing pro se  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea No DL 2:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts State's recommendation for Court Costs plus DNA surcharge - bond to be applied.   DNA sample to be provided directly to WCJ today.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.
